|Intitle=Clinical iconography of a typical example of a parotid tumour complicated by PFP
|Description=Visualisation of parotid tumour invasion suggesting tumour-induced PFP
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=13}}
Please refer to the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available.

question.question: Which of the following best describes the clinical iconography of a typical example of a parotid tumour complicated by PFP (Peripheral Facial Paralysis)?
question.option_a: A video showing the surgical removal of the parotid tumour without any facial paralysis symptoms.
question.option_b: A visual representation of the tumour invading facial nerves, causing facial paralysis.
question.option_c: A series of images depicting the tumour's growth over time without any facial nerve involvement.
question.option_d: A diagram illustrating the anatomical location of the parotid tumour without any mention of facial paralysis.
